text: The beginning of the gospel of Jesus Christ, the Son of God.
speaker: Narrator

text:
As it is written in Isaiah the prophet,
“Behold, I send my messenger before your face,
    who will prepare your way,
speaker: Narrator

text:
the voice of one crying in the wilderness:
    ‘Prepare the way of the Lord,
    make his paths straight,’”
speaker: Narrator

text: John appeared, baptizing in the wilderness and proclaiming a baptism of repentance for the forgiveness of sins.
speaker: Narrator

text: And all the country of Judea and all Jerusalem were going out to him and were being baptized by him in the river Jordan, confessing their sins.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now John was clothed with camel's hair and wore a leather belt round his waist and ate locusts and wild honey.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he preached, saying, “After me comes he who is mightier than I, the strap of whose sandals I am not worthy to stoop down and untie.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have baptized you with water, but he will baptize you with the Holy Spirit.”
speaker: Narrator

text: In those days Jesus came from Nazareth of Galilee and was baptized by John in the Jordan.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when he came up out of the water, immediately he saw the heavens being torn open and the Spirit descending on him like a dove.
speaker: Narrator

text: And a voice came from heaven, “You are my beloved Son; with you I am well pleased.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The Spirit immediately drove him out into the wilderness.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he was in the wilderness forty days, being tempted by Satan. And he was with the wild animals, and the angels were ministering to him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now after John was arrested, Jesus came into Galilee, proclaiming the gospel of God,
speaker: Narrator

text: and saying, “The time is fulfilled, and the kingdom of God is at hand; repent and believe in the gospel.”
speaker: Jesus

text: Passing alongside the Sea of Galilee, he saw Simon and Andrew the brother of Simon casting a net into the sea, for they were fishermen.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jesus said to them, “Follow me, and I will make you become fishers of men.”
speaker: Jesus

text: And immediately they left their nets and followed him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And going on a little farther, he saw James the son of Zebedee and John his brother, who were in their boat mending the nets.
speaker: Narrator

text: And immediately he called them, and they left their father Zebedee in the boat with the hired servants and followed him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they went into Capernaum, and immediately on the Sabbath he entered the synagogue and was teaching.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they were astonished at his teaching, for he taught them as one who had authority, and not as the scribes.
speaker: Narrator

text: And immediately there was in their synagogue a man with an unclean spirit. And he cried out,
speaker: Narrator

text: “What have you to do with us, Jesus of Nazareth? Have you come to destroy us? I know who you are—the Holy One of God.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But Jesus rebuked him, saying, “Be silent, and come out of him!”
speaker: Jesus

text: And the unclean spirit, convulsing him and crying out with a loud voice, came out of him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they were all amazed, so that they questioned among themselves, saying, “What is this? A new teaching with authority! He commands even the unclean spirits, and they obey him.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And at once his fame spread everywhere throughout all the surrounding region of Galilee.
speaker: Narrator

text: And immediately he left the synagogue and entered the house of Simon and Andrew, with James and John.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now Simon's mother-in-law lay ill with a fever, and immediately they told him about her.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he came and took her by the hand and lifted her up, and the fever left her, and she began to serve them.
speaker: Narrator

text: That evening at sunset they brought to him all who were sick or oppressed by demons.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the whole city was gathered together at the door.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he healed many who were sick with various diseases, and cast out many demons. And he would not permit the demons to speak, because they knew him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And rising very early in the morning, while it was still dark, he departed and went out to a desolate place, and there he prayed.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Simon and those who were with him searched for him,
speaker: Narrator

text: and they found him and said to him, “Everyone is looking for you.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said to them, “Let us go on to the next towns, that I may preach there also, for that is what I came for.”
speaker: Jesus

text: And he went throughout all Galilee, preaching in their synagogues and casting out demons.
speaker: Narrator

text: And a leper came to him, imploring him, and kneeling said to him, “If you will, you can make me clean.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Moved with pity, he stretched out his hand and touched him and said to him, “I will; be clean.”
speaker: Jesus

text: And immediately the leprosy left him, and he was made clean.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jesus sternly charged him and sent him away at once,
speaker: Narrator

text: and said to him, “See that you say nothing to anyone, but go, show yourself to the priest and offer for your cleansing what Moses commanded, for a proof to them.”
speaker: Jesus

text: But he went out and began to talk freely about it, and to spread the news, so that Jesus could no longer openly enter a town, but was out in desolate places, and people were coming to him from every quarter.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when he returned to Capernaum after some days, it was reported that he was at home.
speaker: Narrator

text: And many were gathered together, so that there was no more room, not even at the door. And he was preaching the word to them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they came, bringing to him a paralytic carried by four men.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when they could not get near him because of the crowd, they removed the roof above him, and when they had made an opening, they let down the bed on which the paralytic lay.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when Jesus saw their faith, he said to the paralytic, “Son, your sins are forgiven.”
speaker: Jesus

text: Now some of the scribes were sitting there, questioning in their hearts,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Why does this man speak like that? He is blaspheming! Who can forgive sins but God alone?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And immediately Jesus, perceiving in his spirit that they thus questioned within themselves, said to them, “Why do you question these things in your hearts?
speaker: Jesus

text: Which is easier, to say to the paralytic, ‘Your sins are forgiven’, or to say, ‘Rise, take up your bed and walk’?
speaker: Jesus

text: But that you may know that the Son of Man has authority on earth to forgive sins”—he said to the paralytic—
speaker: Jesus

text: “I say to you, rise, pick up your bed, and go home.”
speaker: Jesus

text: And he rose and immediately picked up his bed and went out before them all, so that they were all amazed and glorified God, saying, “We never saw anything like this!”
speaker: Narrator

text: He went out again beside the sea, and all the crowd was coming to him, and he was teaching them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And as he passed by, he saw Levi the son of Alphaeus sitting at the tax booth, and he said to him, “Follow me.” And he rose and followed him.
speaker: Jesus

text: And as he reclined at table in his house, many tax collectors and sinners were reclining with Jesus and his disciples, for there were many who followed him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the scribes of the Pharisees, when they saw that he was eating with sinners and tax collectors, said to his disciples, “Why does he eat with tax collectors and sinners?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And when Jesus heard it, he said to them, “Those who are well have no need of a physician, but those who are sick. I came not to call the righteous, but sinners.”
speaker: Jesus

text: Now John's disciples and the Pharisees were fasting. And people came and said to him, “Why do John's disciples and the disciples of the Pharisees fast, but your disciples do not fast?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jesus said to them, “Can the wedding guests fast while the bridegroom is with them? As long as they have the bridegroom with them, they cannot fast.
speaker: Jesus

text: The days will come when the bridegroom is taken away from them, and then they will fast in that day.
speaker: Jesus

text: No one sews a piece of unshrunk cloth on an old garment. If he does, the patch tears away from it, the new from the old, and a worse tear is made.
speaker: Narrator

text: And no one puts new wine into old wineskins. If he does, the wine will burst the skins—and the wine is destroyed, and so are the skins. But new wine is for fresh wineskins.”
speaker: Jesus

text: One Sabbath he was going through the cornfields, and as they made their way, his disciples began to pluck ears of corn.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Pharisees were saying to him, “Look, why are they doing what is not lawful on the Sabbath?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said to them, “Have you never read what David did, when he was in need and was hungry, he and those who were with him:
speaker: Jesus

text: how he entered the house of God, in the time of Abiathar the high priest, and ate the bread of the Presence, which it is not lawful for any but the priests to eat, and also gave it to those who were with him?”
speaker: Jesus

text: And he said to them, “The Sabbath was made for man, not man for the Sabbath.
speaker: Jesus

text: So the Son of Man is lord even of the Sabbath.”
speaker: Jesus

text: Again he entered the synagogue, and a man was there with a withered hand.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they watched Jesus, to see whether he would heal him on the Sabbath, so that they might accuse him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said to the man with the withered hand, “Come here.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said to them, “Is it lawful on the Sabbath to do good or to do harm, to save life or to kill?” But they were silent.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he looked round at them with anger, grieved at their hardness of heart, and said to the man, “Stretch out your hand.” He stretched it out, and his hand was restored.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Pharisees went out and immediately held counsel with the Herodians against him, how to destroy him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus withdrew with his disciples to the sea, and a great crowd followed, from Galilee and Judea
speaker: Narrator

text: and Jerusalem and Idumea and from beyond the Jordan and from around Tyre and Sidon. When the great crowd heard all that he was doing, they came to him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he told his disciples to have a boat ready for him because of the crowd, lest they crush him,
speaker: Narrator

text: for he had healed many, so that all who had diseases pressed around him to touch him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And whenever the unclean spirits saw him, they fell down before him and cried out, “You are the Son of God.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And he strictly ordered them not to make him known.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he went up on the mountain and called to him those whom he desired, and they came to him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he appointed twelve (whom he also named apostles) so that they might be with him and he might send them out to preach
speaker: Narrator

text: and have authority to cast out demons.
speaker: Narrator

text: He appointed the twelve: Simon (to whom he gave the name Peter);
speaker: Narrator

text: James the son of Zebedee and John the brother of James (to whom he gave the name Boanerges, that is, Sons of Thunder);
speaker: Narrator

text: Andrew, and Philip, and Bartholomew, and Matthew, and Thomas, and James the son of Alphaeus, and Thaddaeus, and Simon the Cananaean,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Judas Iscariot, who betrayed him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he went home, and the crowd gathered again, so that they could not even eat.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when his family heard it, they went out to seize him, for they were saying, “He is out of his mind.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And the scribes who came down from Jerusalem were saying, “He is possessed by Beelzebul,” and “by the prince of demons he casts out the demons.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And he called them to him and said to them in parables, “How can Satan cast out Satan?
speaker: Narrator

text: If a kingdom is divided against itself, that kingdom cannot stand.
speaker: Narrator

text: And if a house is divided against itself, that house will not be able to stand.
speaker: Narrator

text: And if Satan has risen up against himself and is divided, he cannot stand, but is coming to an end.
speaker: Narrator

text: But no one can enter a strong man's house and plunder his goods, unless he first binds the strong man. Then indeed he may plunder his house.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Truly, I say to you, all sins will be forgiven the children of man, and whatever blasphemies they utter,
speaker: Narrator

text: but whoever blasphemes against the Holy Spirit never has forgiveness, but is guilty of an eternal sin”—
speaker: Narrator

text: for they were saying, “He has an unclean spirit.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And his mother and his brothers came, and standing outside they sent to him and called him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And a crowd was sitting around him, and they said to him, “Your mother and your brothers are outside, seeking you.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And he answered them, “Who are my mother and my brothers?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And looking about at those who sat around him, he said, “Here are my mother and my brothers!
speaker: Narrator

text: For whoever does the will of God, he is my brother and sister and mother.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Again he began to teach beside the sea. And a very large crowd gathered about him, so that he got into a boat and sat in it on the sea, and the whole crowd was beside the sea on the land.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he was teaching them many things in parables, and in his teaching he said to them:
speaker: Narrator

text: “Listen! A sower went out to sow.
speaker: Narrator

text: And as he sowed, some seed fell along the path, and the birds came and devoured it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Other seed fell on rocky ground, where it did not have much soil, and immediately it sprang up, since it had no depth of soil.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when the sun rose, it was scorched, and since it had no root, it withered away.
speaker: Narrator

text: Other seed fell among thorns, and the thorns grew up and choked it, and it yielded no grain.
speaker: Narrator

text: And other seeds fell into good soil and produced grain, growing up and increasing and yielding thirtyfold and sixtyfold and a hundredfold.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said, “He who has ears to hear, let him hear.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And when he was alone, those around him with the twelve asked him about the parables.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said to them, “To you has been given the secret of the kingdom of God, but for those outside everything is in parables,
speaker: Narrator

text:
so that
“they may indeed see but not perceive,
    and may indeed hear but not understand,
lest they should turn and be forgiven.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said to them, “Do you not understand this parable? How then will you understand all the parables?
speaker: Narrator

text: The sower sows the word.
speaker: Narrator

text: And these are the ones along the path, where the word is sown: when they hear, Satan immediately comes and takes away the word that is sown in them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And these are the ones sown on rocky ground: the ones who, when they hear the word, immediately receive it with joy.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they have no root in themselves, but endure for a while; then, when tribulation or persecution arises on account of the word, immediately they fall away.
speaker: Narrator

text: And others are the ones sown among thorns. They are those who hear the word,
speaker: Narrator

text: but the cares of the world and the deceitfulness of riches and the desires for other things enter in and choke the word, and it proves unfruitful.
speaker: Narrator

text: But those that were sown on the good soil are the ones who hear the word and accept it and bear fruit, thirtyfold and sixtyfold and a hundredfold.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said to them, “Is a lamp brought in to be put under a basket, or under a bed, and not on a stand?
speaker: Narrator

text: For nothing is hidden except to be made manifest; nor is anything secret except to come to light.
speaker: Narrator

text: If anyone has ears to hear, let him hear.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said to them, “Pay attention to what you hear: with the measure you use, it will be measured to you, and still more will be added to you.
speaker: Narrator

text: For to the one who has, more will be given, and from the one who has not, even what he has will be taken away.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said, “The kingdom of God is as if a man should scatter seed on the ground.
speaker: Narrator

text: He sleeps and rises night and day, and the seed sprouts and grows; he knows not how.
speaker: Narrator

text: The earth produces by itself, first the blade, then the ear, then the full grain in the ear.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when the grain is ripe, at once he puts in the sickle, because the harvest has come.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said, “With what can we compare the kingdom of God, or what parable shall we use for it?
speaker: Narrator

text: It is like a grain of mustard seed, which, when sown on the ground, is the smallest of all the seeds on earth,
speaker: Narrator

text: yet when it is sown it grows up and becomes larger than all the garden plants and puts out large branches, so that the birds of the air can make nests in its shade.”
speaker: Narrator

text: With many such parables he spoke the word to them, as they were able to hear it.
speaker: Narrator

text: He did not speak to them without a parable, but privately to his own disciples he explained everything.
speaker: Narrator

text: On that day, when evening had come, he said to them, “Let us go across to the other side.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And leaving the crowd, they took him with them in the boat, just as he was. And other boats were with him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And a great windstorm arose, and the waves were breaking into the boat, so that the boat was already filling.
speaker: Narrator

text: But he was in the stern, asleep on the cushion. And they woke him and said to him, “Teacher, do you not care that we are perishing?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And he awoke and rebuked the wind and said to the sea, “Peace! Be still!” And the wind ceased, and there was a great calm.
speaker: Narrator

text: He said to them, “Why are you so afraid? Have you still no faith?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And they were filled with great fear and said to one another, “Who then is this, that even the wind and the sea obey him?”
speaker: Narrator

text: They came to the other side of the sea, to the country of the Gerasenes.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when Jesus had stepped out of the boat, immediately there met him out of the tombs a man with an unclean spirit.
speaker: Narrator

text: He lived among the tombs. And no one could bind him any more, not even with a chain,
speaker: Narrator

text: for he had often been bound with shackles and chains, but he wrenched the chains apart, and he broke the shackles in pieces. No one had the strength to subdue him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Night and day among the tombs and on the mountains he was always crying out and cutting himself with stones.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when he saw Jesus from afar, he ran and fell down before him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And crying out with a loud voice, he said, “What have you to do with me, Jesus, Son of the Most High God? I adjure you by God, do not torment me.”
speaker: Narrator

text: For he was saying to him, “Come out of the man, you unclean spirit!”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jesus asked him, “What is your name?” He replied, “My name is Legion, for we are many.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And he begged him earnestly not to send them out of the country.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now a great herd of pigs was feeding there on the hillside,
speaker: Narrator

text: and they begged him, saying, “Send us to the pigs; let us enter them.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So he gave them permission. And the unclean spirits came out, and entered the pigs, and the herd, numbering about two thousand, rushed down the steep bank into the sea and were drowned in the sea.
speaker: Narrator

text: The herdsmen fled and told it in the city and in the country. And people came to see what it was that had happened.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they came to Jesus and saw the demon-possessed man, the one who had had the legion, sitting there, clothed and in his right mind, and they were afraid.
speaker: Narrator

text: And those who had seen it described to them what had happened to the demon-possessed man and to the pigs.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they began to beg Jesus to depart from their region.
speaker: Narrator

text: As he was getting into the boat, the man who had been possessed with demons begged him that he might be with him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he did not permit him but said to him, “Go home to your friends and tell them how much the Lord has done for you, and how he has had mercy on you.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And he went away and began to proclaim in the Decapolis how much Jesus had done for him, and everyone marvelled.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when Jesus had crossed again in the boat to the other side, a great crowd gathered about him, and he was beside the sea.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then came one of the rulers of the synagogue, Jairus by name, and seeing him, he fell at his feet
speaker: Narrator

text: and implored him earnestly, saying, “My little daughter is at the point of death. Come and lay your hands on her, so that she may be made well and live.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
And he went with him.
And a great crowd followed him and thronged about him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And there was a woman who had had a discharge of blood for twelve years,
speaker: Narrator

text: and who had suffered much under many physicians, and had spent all that she had, and was no better but rather grew worse.
speaker: Narrator

text: She had heard the reports about Jesus and came up behind him in the crowd and touched his garment.
speaker: Narrator

text: For she said, “If I touch even his garments, I will be made well.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And immediately the flow of blood dried up, and she felt in her body that she was healed of her disease.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jesus, perceiving in himself that power had gone out from him, immediately turned about in the crowd and said, “Who touched my garments?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And his disciples said to him, “You see the crowd pressing around you, and yet you say, ‘Who touched me?’”
speaker: Narrator

text: And he looked round to see who had done it.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the woman, knowing what had happened to her, came in fear and trembling and fell down before him and told him the whole truth.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said to her, “Daughter, your faith has made you well; go in peace, and be healed of your disease.”
speaker: Narrator

text: While he was still speaking, there came from the ruler's house some who said, “Your daughter is dead. Why trouble the Teacher any further?”
speaker: Narrator

text: But overhearing what they said, Jesus said to the ruler of the synagogue, “Do not fear, only believe.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And he allowed no one to follow him except Peter and James and John the brother of James.
speaker: Narrator

text: They came to the house of the ruler of the synagogue, and Jesus saw a commotion, people weeping and wailing loudly.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when he had entered, he said to them, “Why are you making a commotion and weeping? The child is not dead but sleeping.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And they laughed at him. But he put them all outside and took the child's father and mother and those who were with him and went in where the child was.
speaker: Narrator

text: Taking her by the hand he said to her, “Talitha cumi”, which means, “Little girl, I say to you, arise.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And immediately the girl got up and began walking (for she was twelve years of age), and they were immediately overcome with amazement.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he strictly charged them that no one should know this, and told them to give her something to eat.
speaker: Narrator

text: He went away from there and came to his home town, and his disciples followed him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And on the Sabbath he began to teach in the synagogue, and many who heard him were astonished, saying, “Where did this man get these things? What is the wisdom given to him? How are such mighty works done by his hands?
speaker: Narrator

text: Is not this the carpenter, the son of Mary and brother of James and Joses and Judas and Simon? And are not his sisters here with us?” And they took offence at him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jesus said to them, “A prophet is not without honour, except in his home town and among his relatives and in his own household.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And he could do no mighty work there, except that he laid his hands on a few sick people and healed them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
And he marvelled because of their unbelief.
And he went about among the villages teaching.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he called the twelve and began to send them out two by two, and gave them authority over the unclean spirits.
speaker: Narrator

text: He charged them to take nothing for their journey except a staff—no bread, no bag, no money in their belts—
speaker: Narrator

text: but to wear sandals and not put on two tunics.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said to them, “Whenever you enter a house, stay there until you depart from there.
speaker: Narrator

text: And if any place will not receive you and they will not listen to you, when you leave, shake off the dust that is on your feet as a testimony against them.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So they went out and proclaimed that people should repent.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they cast out many demons and anointed with oil many who were sick and healed them.
speaker: Narrator

text: King Herod heard of it, for Jesus' name had become known. Some said, “John the Baptist has been raised from the dead. That is why these miraculous powers are at work in him.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But others said, “He is Elijah.” And others said, “He is a prophet, like one of the prophets of old.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But when Herod heard of it, he said, “John, whom I beheaded, has been raised.”
speaker: Narrator

text: For it was Herod who had sent and seized John and bound him in prison for the sake of Herodias, his brother Philip's wife, because he had married her.
speaker: Narrator

text: For John had been saying to Herod, “It is not lawful for you to have your brother's wife.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Herodias had a grudge against him and wanted to put him to death. But she could not,
speaker: Narrator

text: for Herod feared John, knowing that he was a righteous and holy man, and he kept him safe. When he heard him, he was greatly perplexed, and yet he heard him gladly.
speaker: Narrator

text: But an opportunity came when Herod on his birthday gave a banquet for his nobles and military commanders and the leading men of Galilee.
speaker: Narrator

text: For when Herodias's daughter came in and danced, she pleased Herod and his guests. And the king said to the girl, “Ask me for whatever you wish, and I will give it to you.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And he vowed to her, “Whatever you ask me, I will give you, up to half of my kingdom.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And she went out and said to her mother, “For what should I ask?” And she said, “The head of John the Baptist.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And she came in immediately with haste to the king and asked, saying, “I want you to give me at once the head of John the Baptist on a platter.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And the king was exceedingly sorry, but because of his oaths and his guests he did not want to break his word to her.

text: And immediately the king sent an executioner with orders to bring John's head. He went and beheaded him in the prison

text: and brought his head on a platter and gave it to the girl, and the girl gave it to her mother.

text: When his disciples heard of it, they came and took his body and laid it in a tomb.

text: The apostles returned to Jesus and told him all that they had done and taught.

text: Now many saw them going and recognized them, and they ran there on foot from all the towns and got there ahead of them.

speaker: Narrator

text: And when evening came, the boat was out on the sea, and he was alone on the land.

text: for they all saw him and were terrified. But immediately he spoke to them and said, “Take heart; it is I. Do not be afraid.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And he got into the boat with them, and the wind ceased. And they were utterly astounded,

text: for they did not understand about the loaves, but their hearts were hardened.

text: When they had crossed over, they came to land at Gennesaret and moored to the shore.

speaker: Narrator

text: Now when the Pharisees gathered to him, with some of the scribes who had come from Jerusalem,
speaker: Narrator

text: they saw that some of his disciples ate with hands that were defiled, that is, unwashed.

text: (For the Pharisees and all the Jews do not eat unless they wash their hands, holding to the tradition of the elders,
speaker: Narrator

text: and when they come from the market-place, they do not eat unless they wash. And there are many other traditions that they observe, such as the washing of cups and pots and copper vessels and dining couches.)
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Pharisees and the scribes asked him, “Why do your disciples not walk according to the tradition of the elders, but eat with defiled hands?”
speaker: Narrator

in vain do they worship me,

text: You leave the commandment of God and hold to the tradition of men.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said to them, “You have a fine way of rejecting the commandment of God in order to establish your tradition!
speaker: Narrator

text: For Moses said, ‘Honour your father and your mother’; and, ‘Whoever reviles father or mother must surely die.’
speaker: Narrator

text: But you say, ‘If a man tells his father or his mother, “Whatever you would have gained from me is Corban”’ (that is, given to God)—
speaker: Narrator

text: then you no longer permit him to do anything for his father or mother,
speaker: Narrator

text: thus making void the word of God by your tradition that you have handed down. And many such things you do.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And he called the people to him again and said to them, “Hear me, all of you, and understand:
speaker: Narrator

text: There is nothing outside a person that by going into him can defile him, but the things that come out of a person are what defile him.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And when he had entered the house and left the people, his disciples asked him about the parable.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said to them, “Then are you also without understanding? Do you not see that whatever goes into a person from outside cannot defile him,
speaker: Narrator

text: since it enters not his heart but his stomach, and is expelled?” (Thus he declared all foods clean.)
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said, “What comes out of a person is what defiles him.
speaker: Narrator

text: For from within, out of the heart of man, come evil thoughts, sexual immorality, theft, murder, adultery,
speaker: Narrator

text: coveting, wickedness, deceit, sensuality, envy, slander, pride, foolishness.
speaker: Narrator

text: All these evil things come from within, and they defile a person.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And from there he arose and went away to the region of Tyre and Sidon. And he entered a house and did not want anyone to know, yet he could not be hidden.
speaker: Narrator

text: But immediately a woman whose little daughter had an unclean spirit heard of him and came and fell down at his feet.
speaker: Narrator

speaker: Narrator

text: And he said to her, “Let the children be fed first, for it is not right to take the children's bread and throw it to the dogs.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But she answered him, “Yes, Lord; yet even the dogs under the table eat the children's crumbs.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said to her, “For this statement you may go your way; the demon has left your daughter.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And she went home and found the child lying in bed and the demon gone.

speaker: Narrator

text: And they were astonished beyond measure, saying, “He has done all things well. He even makes the deaf hear and the mute speak.”

speaker: Narrator

text: “I have compassion on the crowd, because they have been with me now three days and have nothing to eat.
speaker: Narrator

text: And if I send them away hungry to their homes, they will faint on the way. And some of them have come from far away.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And his disciples answered him, “How can one feed these people with bread here in this desolate place?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And he asked them, “How many loaves do you have?” They said, “Seven.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And he directed the crowd to sit down on the ground. And he took the seven loaves, and having given thanks, he broke them and gave them to his disciples to set before the people; and they set them before the crowd.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they had a few small fish. And having blessed them, he said that these also should be set before them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they ate and were satisfied. And they took up the broken pieces left over, seven baskets full.

text: And there were about four thousand people. And he sent them away.
speaker: Narrator

text: And immediately he got into the boat with his disciples and went to the district of Dalmanutha.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Pharisees came and began to argue with him, seeking from him a sign from heaven to test him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he sighed deeply in his spirit and said, “Why does this generation seek a sign? Truly, I say to you, no sign will be given to this generation.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And he left them, got into the boat again, and went to the other side.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now they had forgotten to bring bread, and they had only one loaf with them in the boat.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he cautioned them, saying, “Watch out; beware of the leaven of the Pharisees and the leaven of Herod.”

speaker: Narrator

text: Having eyes do you not see, and having ears do you not hear? And do you not remember?

speaker: Narrator

text: “And the seven for the four thousand, how many baskets full of broken pieces did you take up?” And they said to him, “Seven.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said to them, “Do you not yet understand?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And they came to Bethsaida. And some people brought to him a blind man and begged him to touch him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jesus laid his hands on his eyes again; and he opened his eyes, his sight was restored, and he saw everything clearly.

text: And he sent him to his home, saying, “Do not even enter the village.”

text: And he strictly charged them to tell no one about him.

text: But turning and seeing his disciples, he rebuked Peter and said, “Get behind me, Satan! For you are not setting your mind on the things of God, but on the things of man.”

text: And calling the crowd to him with his disciples, he said to them, “If anyone would come after me, let him deny himself and take up his cross and follow me.

text: For whoever would save his life will lose it, but whoever loses his life for my sake and the gospel's will save it.

speaker: Narrator

text: For what can a man give in return for his soul?

text: And many spread their cloaks on the road, and others spread leafy branches that they had cut from the fields.
speaker: Narrator

text: And those who went before and those who followed were shouting, “Hosanna! Blessed is he who comes in the name of the Lord!
speaker: Narrator

text: Blessed is the coming kingdom of our father David! Hosanna in the highest!”
speaker: Narrator

text: And he entered Jerusalem and went into the temple. And when he had looked around at everything, as it was already late, he went out to Bethany with the twelve.
speaker: Narrator

text: On the following day, when they came from Bethany, he was hungry.
speaker: Narrator

text: And seeing in the distance a fig tree in leaf, he went to see if he could find anything on it. When he came to it, he found nothing but leaves, for it was not the season for figs.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said to it, “May no one ever eat fruit from you again.” And his disciples heard it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they came to Jerusalem. And he entered the temple and began to drive out those who sold and those who bought in the temple, and he overturned the tables of the money-changers and the seats of those who sold pigeons.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he would not allow anyone to carry anything through the temple.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he was teaching them and saying to them, “Is it not written, ‘My house shall be called a house of prayer for all the nations’? But you have made it a den of robbers.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And the chief priests and the scribes heard it and were seeking a way to destroy him, for they feared him, because all the crowd was astonished at his teaching.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when evening came they went out of the city.
speaker: Narrator

text: As they passed by in the morning, they saw the fig tree withered away to its roots.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Peter remembered and said to him, “Rabbi, look! The fig tree that you cursed has withered.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jesus answered them, “Have faith in God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Truly, I say to you, whoever says to this mountain, ‘Be taken up and thrown into the sea’, and does not doubt in his heart, but believes that what he says will come to pass, it will be done for him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore I tell you, whatever you ask in prayer, believe that you have received it, and it will be yours.
speaker: Narrator

text: And whenever you stand praying, forgive, if you have anything against anyone, so that your Father also who is in heaven may forgive you your trespasses.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And they came again to Jerusalem. And as he was walking in the temple, the chief priests and the scribes and the elders came to him,
speaker: Narrator

text: and they said to him, “By what authority are you doing these things, or who gave you this authority to do them?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said to them, “I will ask you one question; answer me, and I will tell you by what authority I do these things.
speaker: Narrator

text: Was the baptism of John from heaven or from man? Answer me.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And they discussed it with one another, saying, “If we say, ‘From heaven’, he will say, ‘Why then did you not believe him?’
speaker: Narrator

text: But shall we say, ‘From man’?”—they were afraid of the people, for they all held that John really was a prophet.
speaker: Narrator

text: So they answered Jesus, “We do not know.” And Jesus said to them, “Neither will I tell you by what authority I do these things.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And he began to speak to them in parables. “A man planted a vineyard and put a fence around it and dug a pit for the wine press and built a tower, and leased it to tenants and went into another country.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the season came, he sent a servant to the tenants to get from them some of the fruit of the vineyard.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they took him and beat him and sent him away empty-handed.
speaker: Narrator

text: Again he sent to them another servant, and they struck him on the head and treated him shamefully.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he sent another, and him they killed. And so with many others: some they beat, and some they killed.
speaker: Narrator

text: He had still one other, a beloved son. Finally he sent him to them, saying, ‘They will respect my son.’
speaker: Narrator

text: But those tenants said to one another, ‘This is the heir. Come, let us kill him, and the inheritance will be ours.’
speaker: Narrator

text: And they took him and killed him and threw him out of the vineyard.
speaker: Narrator

text: What will the owner of the vineyard do? He will come and destroy the tenants and give the vineyard to others.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
this was the Lord's doing,
    and it is marvellous in our eyes’?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And they were seeking to arrest him but feared the people, for they perceived that he had told the parable against them. So they left him and went away.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they sent to him some of the Pharisees and some of the Herodians, to trap him in his talk.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they came and said to him, “Teacher, we know that you are true and do not care about anyone's opinion. For you are not swayed by appearances, but truly teach the way of God. Is it lawful to pay taxes to Caesar, or not? Should we pay them, or should we not?”
speaker: Narrator

text: But, knowing their hypocrisy, he said to them, “Why put me to the test? Bring me a denarius and let me look at it.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And they brought one. And he said to them, “Whose likeness and inscription is this?” They said to him, “Caesar's.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said to them, “Render to Caesar the things that are Caesar's, and to God the things that are God's.” And they marvelled at him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Sadducees came to him, who say that there is no resurrection. And they asked him a question, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Teacher, Moses wrote for us that if a man's brother dies and leaves a wife, but leaves no child, the man must take the widow and raise up offspring for his brother.
speaker: Narrator

text: There were seven brothers; the first took a wife, and when he died left no offspring.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the second took her, and died, leaving no offspring. And the third likewise.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the seven left no offspring. Last of all the woman also died.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the resurrection, when they rise again, whose wife will she be? For the seven had her as wife.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said to them, “Is this not the reason you are wrong, because you know neither the Scriptures nor the power of God?
speaker: Narrator

text: For when they rise from the dead, they neither marry nor are given in marriage, but are like angels in heaven.
speaker: Narrator

text: And as for the dead being raised, have you not read in the book of Moses, in the passage about the bush, how God spoke to him, saying, ‘I am the God of Abraham, and the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob’?
speaker: Narrator

text: He is not God of the dead, but of the living. You are quite wrong.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And one of the scribes came up and heard them disputing with one another, and seeing that he answered them well, asked him, “Which commandment is the most important of all?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered, “The most important is, ‘Hear, O Israel: The Lord our God, the Lord is one.
speaker: Narrator

text: And you shall love the Lord your God with all your heart and with all your soul and with all your mind and with all your strength.’
speaker: Narrator

text: The second is this: ‘You shall love your neighbour as yourself.’ There is no other commandment greater than these.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And the scribe said to him, “You are right, Teacher. You have truly said that he is one, and there is no other besides him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And to love him with all the heart and with all the understanding and with all the strength, and to love one's neighbour as oneself, is much more than all whole burnt offerings and sacrifices.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And when Jesus saw that he answered wisely, he said to him, “You are not far from the kingdom of God.” And after that no one dared to ask him any more questions.
speaker: Narrator

text: And as Jesus taught in the temple, he said, “How can the scribes say that the Christ is the son of David?
speaker: Narrator

text:
David himself, in the Holy Spirit, declared,
“‘The Lord said to my Lord,
Sit at my right hand,
    until I put your enemies under your feet.’
speaker: Narrator

text: David himself calls him Lord. So how is he his son?” And the great throng heard him gladly.
speaker: Narrator

text: And in his teaching he said, “Beware of the scribes, who like to walk around in long robes and like greetings in the market-places
speaker: Narrator

text: and have the best seats in the synagogues and the places of honour at feasts,
speaker: Narrator

text: who devour widows' houses and for a pretence make long prayers. They will receive the greater condemnation.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And he sat down opposite the treasury and watched the people putting money into the offering box. Many rich people put in large sums.
speaker: Narrator

text: And a poor widow came and put in two small copper coins, which make a penny.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he called his disciples to him and said to them, “Truly, I say to you, this poor widow has put in more than all those who are contributing to the offering box.
speaker: Narrator

text: For they all contributed out of their abundance, but she out of her poverty has put in everything she had, all she had to live on.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And as he came out of the temple, one of his disciples said to him, “Look, Teacher, what wonderful stones and what wonderful buildings!”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jesus said to him, “Do you see these great buildings? There will not be left here one stone upon another that will not be thrown down.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And as he sat on the Mount of Olives opposite the temple, Peter and James and John and Andrew asked him privately,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Tell us, when will these things be, and what will be the sign when all these things are about to be accomplished?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jesus began to say to them, “See that no one leads you astray.
speaker: Narrator

text: Many will come in my name, saying, ‘I am he!’ and they will lead many astray.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when you hear of wars and rumours of wars, do not be alarmed. This must take place, but the end is not yet.
speaker: Narrator

text: For nation will rise against nation, and kingdom against kingdom. There will be earthquakes in various places; there will be famines. These are but the beginning of the birth pains.
speaker: Narrator

text: “But be on your guard. For they will deliver you over to councils, and you will be beaten in synagogues, and you will stand before governors and kings for my sake, to bear witness before them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the gospel must first be proclaimed to all nations.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when they bring you to trial and deliver you over, do not be anxious beforehand what you are to say, but say whatever is given you in that hour, for it is not you who speak, but the Holy Spirit.
speaker: Narrator

text: And brother will deliver brother over to death, and the father his child, and children will rise against parents and have them put to death.
speaker: Narrator

text: And you will be hated by all for my name's sake. But the one who endures to the end will be saved.
speaker: Narrator

text: “But when you see the abomination of desolation standing where he ought not to be (let the reader understand), then let those who are in Judea flee to the mountains.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let the one who is on the housetop not go down, nor enter his house, to take anything out,
speaker: Narrator

text: and let the one who is in the field not turn back to take his cloak.
speaker: Narrator

text: And alas for women who are pregnant and for those who are nursing infants in those days!
speaker: Narrator

text: Pray that it may not happen in winter.
speaker: Narrator

text: For in those days there will be such tribulation as has not been from the beginning of the creation that God created until now, and never will be.
speaker: Narrator

text: And if the Lord had not cut short the days, no human being would be saved. But for the sake of the elect, whom he chose, he shortened the days.
speaker: Narrator

text: And then if anyone says to you, ‘Look, here is the Christ!’ or ‘Look, there he is!’ do not believe it.
speaker: Narrator

text: For false christs and false prophets will arise and perform signs and wonders, to lead astray, if possible, the elect.
speaker: Narrator

text: But be on guard; I have told you all things beforehand.
speaker: Narrator

text: “But in those days, after that tribulation, the sun will be darkened, and the moon will not give its light,
speaker: Narrator

text: and the stars will be falling from heaven, and the powers in the heavens will be shaken.
speaker: Narrator

text: And then they will see the Son of Man coming in clouds with great power and glory.
speaker: Narrator

text: And then he will send out the angels and gather his elect from the four winds, from the ends of the earth to the ends of heaven.
speaker: Narrator

text: “From the fig tree learn its lesson: as soon as its branch becomes tender and puts out its leaves, you know that summer is near.
speaker: Narrator

text: So also, when you see these things taking place, you know that he is near, at the very gates.
speaker: Narrator

text: Truly, I say to you, this generation will not pass away until all these things take place.
speaker: Narrator

text: Heaven and earth will pass away, but my words will not pass away.
speaker: Narrator

text: “But concerning that day or that hour, no one knows, not even the angels in heaven, nor the Son, but only the Father.
speaker: Narrator

text: Be on guard, keep awake. For you do not know when the time will come.
speaker: Narrator

text: It is like a man going on a journey, when he leaves home and puts his servants in charge, each with his work, and commands the doorkeeper to stay awake.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore stay awake—for you do not know when the master of the house will come, in the evening, or at midnight, or when the cock crows, or in the morning—
speaker: Narrator

text: lest he come suddenly and find you asleep.
speaker: Narrator

text: And what I say to you I say to all: Stay awake.”
speaker: Narrator

text: It was now two days before the Passover and the Feast of Unleavened Bread. And the chief priests and the scribes were seeking how to arrest him by stealth and kill him,
speaker: Narrator

text: for they said, “Not during the feast, lest there be an uproar from the people.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And while he was at Bethany in the house of Simon the leper, as he was reclining at table, a woman came with an alabaster flask of ointment of pure nard, very costly, and she broke the flask and poured it over his head.
speaker: Narrator

text: There were some who said to themselves indignantly, “Why was the ointment wasted like that?
speaker: Narrator

text: For this ointment could have been sold for more than three hundred denarii and given to the poor.” And they scolded her.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Jesus said, “Leave her alone. Why do you trouble her? She has done a beautiful thing to me.
speaker: Narrator

text: For you always have the poor with you, and whenever you want, you can do good for them. But you will not always have me.
speaker: Narrator

text: She has done what she could; she has anointed my body beforehand for burial.
speaker: Narrator

text: And truly, I say to you, wherever the gospel is proclaimed in the whole world, what she has done will be told in memory of her.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Judas Iscariot, who was one of the twelve, went to the chief priests in order to betray him to them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when they heard it, they were glad and promised to give him money. And he sought an opportunity to betray him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And on the first day of Unleavened Bread, when they sacrificed the Passover lamb, his disciples said to him, “Where will you have us go and prepare for you to eat the Passover?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And he sent two of his disciples and said to them, “Go into the city, and a man carrying a jar of water will meet you. Follow him,
speaker: Narrator

text: and wherever he enters, say to the master of the house, ‘The Teacher says, Where is my guest room, where I may eat the Passover with my disciples?’
speaker: Narrator

text: And he will show you a large upper room furnished and ready; there prepare for us.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And the disciples set out and went to the city and found it just as he had told them, and they prepared the Passover.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when it was evening, he came with the twelve.
speaker: Narrator

text: And as they were reclining at table and eating, Jesus said, “Truly, I say to you, one of you will betray me, one who is eating with me.”
speaker: Narrator

text: They began to be sorrowful and to say to him one after another, “Is it I?”
speaker: Narrator

text: He said to them, “It is one of the twelve, one who is dipping bread into the dish with me.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the Son of Man goes as it is written of him, but woe to that man by whom the Son of Man is betrayed! It would have been better for that man if he had not been born.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And as they were eating, he took bread, and after blessing it broke it and gave it to them, and said, “Take; this is my body.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And he took a cup, and when he had given thanks he gave it to them, and they all drank of it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said to them, “This is my blood of the covenant, which is poured out for many.
speaker: Narrator

text: Truly, I say to you, I will not drink again of the fruit of the vine until that day when I drink it new in the kingdom of God.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And when they had sung a hymn, they went out to the Mount of Olives.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jesus said to them, “You will all fall away, for it is written, ‘I will strike the shepherd, and the sheep will be scattered.’
speaker: Narrator

text: But after I am raised up, I will go before you to Galilee.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Peter said to him, “Even though they all fall away, I will not.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jesus said to him, “Truly, I tell you, this very night, before the cock crows twice, you will deny me three times.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But he said emphatically, “If I must die with you, I will not deny you.” And they all said the same.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they went to a place called Gethsemane. And he said to his disciples, “Sit here while I pray.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And he took with him Peter and James and John, and began to be greatly distressed and troubled.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said to them, “My soul is very sorrowful, even to death. Remain here and watch.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And going a little farther, he fell on the ground and prayed that, if it were possible, the hour might pass from him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said, “Abba, Father, all things are possible for you. Remove this cup from me. Yet not what I will, but what you will.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And he came and found them sleeping, and he said to Peter, “Simon, are you asleep? Could you not watch one hour?
speaker: Narrator

text: Watch and pray that you may not enter into temptation. The spirit indeed is willing, but the flesh is weak.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And again he went away and prayed, saying the same words.
speaker: Narrator

text: And again he came and found them sleeping, for their eyes were very heavy, and they did not know what to answer him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he came the third time and said to them, “Are you still sleeping and taking your rest? It is enough; the hour has come. The Son of Man is betrayed into the hands of sinners.
speaker: Narrator

text: Rise, let us be going; see, my betrayer is at hand.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And immediately, while he was still speaking, Judas came, one of the twelve, and with him a crowd with swords and clubs, from the chief priests and the scribes and the elders.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the betrayer had given them a sign, saying, “The one I will kiss is the man. Seize him and lead him away under guard.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And when he came, he went up to him at once and said, “Rabbi!” And he kissed him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they laid hands on him and seized him.
speaker: Narrator

text: But one of those who stood by drew his sword and struck the servant of the high priest and cut off his ear.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jesus said to them, “Have you come out as against a robber, with swords and clubs to capture me?
speaker: Narrator

text: Day after day I was with you in the temple teaching, and you did not seize me. But let the Scriptures be fulfilled.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And they all left him and fled.
speaker: Narrator

text: And a young man followed him, with nothing but a linen cloth about his body. And they seized him,
speaker: Narrator

text: but he left the linen cloth and ran away naked.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they led Jesus to the high priest. And all the chief priests and the elders and the scribes came together.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Peter had followed him at a distance, right into the courtyard of the high priest. And he was sitting with the guards and warming himself at the fire.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the chief priests and the whole Council were seeking testimony against Jesus to put him to death, but they found none.
speaker: Narrator

text: For many bore false witness against him, but their testimony did not agree.
speaker: Narrator

text: And some stood up and bore false witness against him, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “We heard him say, ‘I will destroy this temple that is made with hands, and in three days I will build another, not made with hands.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: Yet even about this their testimony did not agree.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the high priest stood up in the midst and asked Jesus, “Have you no answer to make? What is it that these men testify against you?”
speaker: Narrator

text: But he remained silent and made no answer. Again the high priest asked him, “Are you the Christ, the Son of the Blessed?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jesus said, “I am, and you will see the Son of Man seated at the right hand of Power, and coming with the clouds of heaven.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And the high priest tore his garments and said, “What further witnesses do we need?
speaker: Narrator

text: You have heard his blasphemy. What is your decision?” And they all condemned him as deserving death.
speaker: Narrator

text: And some began to spit on him and to cover his face and to strike him, saying to him, “Prophesy!” And the guards received him with blows.
speaker: Narrator

text: And as Peter was below in the courtyard, one of the servant girls of the high priest came,
speaker: Narrator

text: and seeing Peter warming himself, she looked at him and said, “You also were with the Nazarene, Jesus.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But he denied it, saying, “I neither know nor understand what you mean.” And he went out into the gateway and the cock crowed.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the servant girl saw him and began again to say to the bystanders, “This man is one of them.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But again he denied it. And after a little while the bystanders again said to Peter, “Certainly you are one of them, for you are a Galilean.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But he began to invoke a curse on himself and to swear, “I do not know this man of whom you speak.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And immediately the cock crowed a second time. And Peter remembered how Jesus had said to him, “Before the cock crows twice, you will deny me three times.” And he broke down and wept.
speaker: Narrator

text: And as soon as it was morning, the chief priests held a consultation with the elders and scribes and the whole Council. And they bound Jesus and led him away and delivered him over to Pilate.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Pilate asked him, “Are you the King of the Jews?” And he answered him, “You have said so.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And the chief priests accused him of many things.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Pilate again asked him, “Have you no answer to make? See how many charges they bring against you.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But Jesus made no further answer, so that Pilate was amazed.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now at the feast he used to release for them one prisoner for whom they asked.
speaker: Narrator

text: And among the rebels in prison, who had committed murder in the insurrection, there was a man called Barabbas.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the crowd came up and began to ask Pilate to do as he usually did for them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he answered them, saying, “Do you want me to release for you the King of the Jews?”
speaker: Narrator

text: For he perceived that it was out of envy that the chief priests had delivered him up.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the chief priests stirred up the crowd to have him release for them Barabbas instead.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Pilate again said to them, “Then what shall I do with the man you call the King of the Jews?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And they cried out again, “Crucify him.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Pilate said to them, “Why, what evil has he done?” But they shouted all the more, “Crucify him.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Pilate, wishing to satisfy the crowd, released for them Barabbas, and having scourged Jesus, he delivered him to be crucified.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the soldiers led him away inside the palace (that is, the governor's headquarters), and they called together the whole battalion.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they clothed him in a purple cloak, and twisting together a crown of thorns, they put it on him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they began to salute him, “Hail, King of the Jews!”
speaker: Narrator

text: And they were striking his head with a reed and spitting on him and kneeling down in homage to him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when they had mocked him, they stripped him of the purple cloak and put his own clothes on him. And they led him out to crucify him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they compelled a passer-by, Simon of Cyrene, who was coming in from the country, the father of Alexander and Rufus, to carry his cross.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they brought him to the place called Golgotha (which means Place of a Skull).
speaker: Narrator

text: And they offered him wine mixed with myrrh, but he did not take it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they crucified him and divided his garments among them, casting lots for them, to decide what each should take.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it was the third hour when they crucified him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the inscription of the charge against him read, “The King of the Jews.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And with him they crucified two robbers, one on his right and one on his left.
speaker: Narrator

text: And those who passed by derided him, wagging their heads and saying, “Aha! You who would destroy the temple and rebuild it in three days,
speaker: Narrator

text: save yourself, and come down from the cross!”
speaker: Narrator

text: So also the chief priests with the scribes mocked him to one another, saying, “He saved others; he cannot save himself.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let the Christ, the King of Israel, come down now from the cross that we may see and believe.” Those who were crucified with him also reviled him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when the sixth hour had come, there was darkness over the whole land until the ninth hour.
speaker: Narrator

text: And at the ninth hour Jesus cried with a loud voice, “Eloi, Eloi, lema sabachthani?” which means, “My God, my God, why have you forsaken me?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And some of the bystanders hearing it said, “Behold, he is calling Elijah.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And someone ran and filled a sponge with sour wine, put it on a reed and gave it to him to drink, saying, “Wait, let us see whether Elijah will come to take him down.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jesus uttered a loud cry and breathed his last.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the curtain of the temple was torn in two, from top to bottom.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when the centurion, who stood facing him, saw that in this way he breathed his last, he said, “Truly this man was the Son of God!”
speaker: Narrator

text: There were also women looking on from a distance, among whom were Mary Magdalene, and Mary the mother of James the younger and of Joses, and Salome.
speaker: Narrator

text: When he was in Galilee, they followed him and ministered to him, and there were also many other women who came up with him to Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when evening had come, since it was the day of Preparation, that is, the day before the Sabbath,
speaker: Narrator

text: Joseph of Arimathea, a respected member of the Council, who was also himself looking for the kingdom of God, took courage and went to Pilate and asked for the body of Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: Pilate was surprised to hear that he should have already died. And summoning the centurion, he asked him whether he was already dead.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when he learned from the centurion that he was dead, he granted the corpse to Joseph.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Joseph bought a linen shroud, and taking him down, wrapped him in the linen shroud and laid him in a tomb that had been cut out of the rock. And he rolled a stone against the entrance of the tomb.
speaker: Narrator

text: Mary Magdalene and Mary the mother of Joses saw where he was laid.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the Sabbath was past, Mary Magdalene and Mary the mother of James and Salome bought spices, so that they might go and anoint him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And very early on the first day of the week, when the sun had risen, they went to the tomb.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they were saying to one another, “Who will roll away the stone for us from the entrance of the tomb?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And looking up, they saw that the stone had been rolled back—it was very large.
speaker: Narrator

text: And entering the tomb, they saw a young man sitting on the right side, dressed in a white robe, and they were alarmed.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said to them, “Do not be alarmed. You seek Jesus of Nazareth, who was crucified. He has risen; he is not here. See the place where they laid him.
speaker: Narrator

text: But go, tell his disciples and Peter that he is going before you to Galilee. There you will see him, just as he told you.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And they went out and fled from the tomb, for trembling and astonishment had seized them, and they said nothing to anyone, for they were afraid.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now when he rose early on the first day of the week, he appeared first to Mary Magdalene, from whom he had cast out seven demons.
speaker: Narrator

text: She went and told those who had been with him, as they mourned and wept.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when they heard that he was alive and had been seen by her, they would not believe it.
speaker: Narrator

text: After these things he appeared in another form to two of them, as they were walking into the country.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they went back and told the rest, but they did not believe them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Afterwards he appeared to the eleven themselves as they were reclining at table, and he rebuked them for their unbelief and hardness of heart, because they had not believed those who saw him after he had risen.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said to them, “Go into all the world and proclaim the gospel to the whole creation.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whoever believes and is baptized will be saved, but whoever does not believe will be condemned.
speaker: Narrator

text: And these signs will accompany those who believe: in my name they will cast out demons; they will speak in new tongues;
speaker: Narrator

text: they will pick up serpents with their hands; and if they drink any deadly poison, it will not hurt them; they will lay their hands on the sick, and they will recover.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So then the Lord Jesus, after he had spoken to them, was taken up into heaven and sat down at the right hand of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they went out and preached everywhere, while the Lord worked with them and confirmed the message by accompanying signs.
speaker: Narrator
